## Textbooks

* All in **R**: Lovelace, Nowosad, and Muenchow (2024). *[Geocomputation with R](https://r.geocompx.org/preface){target='_blank'}* (**Legally free online book!**)
* All in **Python**: Rey, Arribas-Bel, and Wolf (2023). *[Geographic Data Science with Python](https://geographicdata.science/book/intro.html){target='_blank'}* (**Also a legally free online book!**)

## Lecture Videos

* For a high-level overview, that will prepare you well for this course, see [Coursera: Introduction to GIS](https://www.coursera.org/learn/gis/lecture/S0HxB/why-gis-is-awesome){target='_blank'}

## Course Materials

* If you're looking to dive headfirst into more intensive statistical modeling of geospatial data, definitely check out [Data Over Space and Time](https://www.stat.cmu.edu/~cshalizi/dst/20/){target='_blank'}, a course taught by Cosma Shalizi, a very cool professor of Statistics at Carnegie Mellon University.
